definition: to return/to come back
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Taking time out from their heartbreak, they get back to nature.
sentences.chinese: 逐步从心碎的爱情中走出来后，他们复归自然。

sentences.english: The depression was slackened off and prosperity was returning.
sentences.chinese: 萧条渐趋缓和，繁荣正在复归。

sentences.english: From death life emerges, in the end.
sentences.chinese: 生命从死亡中复归，结局如是说。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the water column retractable -chuen, mouth, all reverted to calm.
sentences.chinese: 转瞬间，水柱缩回泉口，一切复归平静。

sentences.english: Finally, we call for the rebuilding of the soul of learning and seek out the reverted road of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 论文最后，大声疾呼要重建学魂并探求学魂复归之路。

sentences.english: She would behave normally, I would behave normally, and everything would be normal again.
sentences.chinese: 她会表现正常，我会举止得体，一切都又会复归平常。

sentences.english: The Imperial Granary edition The Peony Pavilion offers a concept of returning to the original state of Kunqu Opera.
sentences.chinese: 皇家粮仓版《牡丹亭》以复归昆曲肇始状态的理念。

sentences.english: If he dies without leaving an heir, his lands will revert to the state.
sentences.chinese: 如果他死后无继承人，其土地将复归国家所有。

to sink/to drown

vanished from the face of the earth/all gone/nothing left

similar/almost/if only/maybe
the Daoist doctrine of inaction/let things take their own course/laissez-faire
Wuwei county in Chaohu 巢湖[Chao2 hu2], Anhui
to migrate/to move house
for this reason
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
to live away from home temporarily
to inhabit/to live (in a habitat)

the starting point
to die (Buddhism)
